MariaDB (also MySQL)

MariaDB is a relational database that uses the SQL language. It is a drop-in, open-source replacement for MySQL.

It represents the ‘M’ in the LAMP Stack.

See Also:

  • Overview of the MariaDB Server
  • Notes on MariaDB Setup

External Links:

  • MariaDB.org
  • sqlteaching.com
  • Introduction to Databases - Stanford
